title: Controller
description:

About Mead Quin, Inc.Mead Quin is a high\-end residential design firm based in the San Francisco Bay Area, known for a signature aesthetic of refined minimalism and calming, human\-centered interiors that prioritize wellness and a connection to nature. Founded in 2013 by Principal Designer Mead Quin, our studio operates on a philosophy of "beauty simplified," collaboration, and high standards. We are a fast\-paced, mentorship\-driven environment that values open dialogue, professional growth, and an acute attention to detail.Description

The **Controller** will be our senior accounting leader, overseeing all financial operations and ensuring accuracy and compliance. This is a hands\-on role that bridges finance, operations, and executive leadership to support informed decision\-making within our dynamic, project\-based professional services environment. You will manage the entire accounting cycle, from daily transactions to high\-level financial strategy, reporting to the firm's management and working closely with the Fractional CFO, with ultimate accountability to the Principal, Mead Quin.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Financial Operations, Reporting \& Analysis:** Help drive the monthly invoicing activity, perform the month\-end and year\-end close processes, prepare timely and accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in accordance with GAAP, and provide actionable insights and variance reports to senior management.
* **Project Accounting \& Management:** Manage project\-based accounting, including maintaining work\-in\-progress (WIP) schedules, tracking project costs versus budgets, and preparing profitability reports.
* **Cash Flow \& Budgeting:** Develop and maintain cash flow forecasts, manage working capital, and oversee the annual operating budget preparation process. Conduct cost\-benefit analyses to inform strategic decisions.
* **Compliance \& Controls:** Develop and enforce internal controls to protect company assets, policies, procedures, and workflows. Oversee all tax filings (payroll, sales/use, income), filing returns where appropriate, respond to all external regulatory inquiries, and facilitate tax preparation with our independent CPA firm.
* **Team Leadership:** Lead and mentor the accounting team, fostering a culture of accountability and professional development. Collaborate with cross\-functional teams (design, studio operations) to ensure financial efficiency and alignment with business goals.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or business; CMA or MBA highly desirable
* 8–10\+ years of related work experience, with at least 5 years in a leadership/Controller role, ideally within an architecture, engineering, or design (AEC) firm.
* Highly ethical professional with superb analytical, problem\-solving, and communication skills
* Exposure to sales and use tax application; multi\-state contexts preferred (CA, NV, FL)
* Experience in budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis and dashboard reporting and projections
* Strong project management, organization, and documentation skills
* Extensive prior experience leading and executing AP, AR, payroll, project accounting, inventory, and merchandise sales
* Strong systems proficiency: Intermediate Excel/Google Sheets toolset required, along with a demonstrated ability to learn new systems. Systems in current use: Studio Designer, Monograph, Bill.com, Gusto
* Ability to thrive in a fast\-paced environment, manage multiple priorities, and work cooperatively with all levels of employees
* Willing and able to take 12 hours of continuing education per year

**Perks \& Benefits**

We offer a supportive environment and a comprehensive benefits package designed to support your well\-being and growth:

* **Competitive Compensation:** $135,000 to $185,000 annually (commensurate with experience)
* **Time Off:** 120 hours of PTO per year (total) and approximately 11–13 paid holidays
* **Hybrid Flexibility:** In\-office work Monday\-Thursday, with an optional work\-from\-home environment on Fridays
* **Financial Health:** 401(k) with 4% company match (after 6 months), discretionary bonuses, and mileage reimbursement
* **Health Insurance:** 100% employer\-paid coverage for the employee under the Kaiser Silver plan (with upgrade options available for health, dental, and vision coverages)
* **Professional Development:** Monthly "Learning Lessons" sessions, offsite visits, and opportunities to expand your skillset in a collaborative learning environment
* **Studio Culture:** Regular wellness wind\-downs (happy hours), team socials, and birthday celebrations foster strong team connection

description:
**Chief Financial Officer (CFO) – Fractional\-to\-Full\-Time Path (Boston)**

**Location:** Boston, MA (International operation)  
**Job Type:** Full\-time pathway via initial fractional engagement  
**Travel:** up to \~15%  
**Compensation:** 1099 to start with the opportunity to convert to full time with competitive base \+ performance incentives \+ equity potential \+ benefits (at full\-time conversion)

**About the Opportunity**

The CFO Centre is recruiting an experience CFO for a high\-growth, global medical technology manufacturer based in the Boston area, a current client of the CFO Centre. The company has a 30\+ year track record serving specialized healthcare and life sciences markets and is now entering its next growth chapter, including U.S. expansion as co\-HQ office, software\-enabled offerings, and deeper penetration into Cell \& Gene Therapy\-related markets.

This role is designed as a **fractional\-to\-full\-time transition**:

* You begin as a CFO Centre fractional CFO, initially dedicating \~30–50% capacity to this client.
* Over an estimated 3–6 month period, as scope matures, the role is expected to transition into a full\-time position directly with the client (a current CFO Centre client).
* The plan is to start with the CFO Centre and transition to full time based upon the requirements of the business. This opportunity is designed with flexibility in mind:
* Both you and the company get to know each other before agreeing to employment terms;
* During the ramp period, you may also support other select CFO Centre assignments to bolster income;
* If preferred, you may choose to remain with the CFO Centre long\-term in a fractional portfolio model

This structure provides a high\-quality “mutual fit” pathway while ensuring immediate strategic finance leadership continuity.

**What You’ll Do**

As CFO, you will partner with the CEO and executive team to lead global finance and enable scale. Key responsibilities include:

* Lead global financial strategy, planning, and performance management
* Build and evolve monthly/quarterly/annual reporting packages (financials \+ KPIs)
* Oversee accounting, tax, compliance, and statutory reporting across multiple countries
* Manage finance operations involving U.S. and Italian entities, including intercompany structures/charges
* Support and maintain compliance frameworks, including Qualified Small Business (QSB/QSBS\-related) considerations
* Drive fundraising processes end\-to\-end (deck development, terms negotiation, board/CEO communication, diligence/data room, close)
* Lead buy\-side/sell\-side diligence and exit\-readiness planning
* Partner on strategic initiatives including market expansion and platform evolution
* Oversee external auditors and third\-party partners (banking, legal, audit, IT, insurance, benefits)
* Manage and mentor remote/global finance talent
* Support import/export process awareness and controls relevant to U.S./EU operations

**What We’re Looking For**

* 10\+ years in senior finance leadership roles (CFO or equivalent)
* Proven leadership across multi\-country finance teams and operations
* Strong experience in cross\-border finance, especially U.S.\-Europe structures
* Demonstrated success in equity/debt fundraising and transaction execution
* Deep command of financial planning, KPI architecture, and board\-level reporting
* Track record of strategic partnership with CEOs and leadership teams
* Experience managing compliance across jurisdictions
* Experience coordinating with external auditors and advisors
* Strong operator mindset: strategic and hands\-on
* MBA preferred, CPA a bonus

**Ideal Background**

We’re especially interested in candidates who combine:

* Medical device / healthcare / life sciences exposure (highly valued)
* International operating experience
* Growth\-stage or transformation experience (new markets, platform expansion, commercialization support)
* Calm execution style with high accountability and communication rigor

**Why This Role Is Distinct**

* Immediate, meaningful impact in a globally active business
* Defined runway to a full\-time CFO seat with a thoughtful transition model
* Flexibility and optionality through the CFO Centre platform
* Opportunity to shape growth strategy, fundraising narrative, and enterprise value creation

**About The CFO Centre**

The CFO Centre is a global CFO services firm known for its fractional CFO practice of experienced finance leaders. We work with ambitious businesses that need strategic financial leadership to scale, transform, execute, and exit with confidence.

**To apply on Indeed:**  
Please submit your resume/CV and a brief note outlining:

* your cross\-border CFO experience,

The CFO Centre and our client are equal opportunity employers. We welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

Karifin Partners is seeking an experienced Accounting Professional to fill a full\-time Accountant/Controller role in our Canon City office. Our women\-led firm provides Grant Administration, Fractional CFO and Accounting services to nonprofits, businesses, and quasi\-governmental entities nationwide. This position plays a key role in Karifin Partner’s daily operations. Our ideal candidate is an exceptional Accounting Professional with a proven track record who is comfortable working with our variety of clients, takes pride in their work accuracy, and is interested in long\-term growth within a collaborative and rapidly growing firm.

Position Summary

The Accountant/Controller is a key member of the accounting team, responsible for delivering accurate, timely accounting services and clear communication to our clients. This role requires strong ownership of assigned responsibilities, and the initiative to identify and solve problems. The ideal candidate thrives in a client\-facing environment, values accuracy and confidentiality, and works well both independently and with the team as part of a growing firm. Core responsibilities include accounts payable/receivable, bank reconciliations, payroll, organizing and recording transactions, adjusting journal entries, and supporting compliance requirements, while ensuring client satisfaction and confidentiality.

* 5 or more years of office or full\-cycle accounting experience
* 2\-year degree in Accounting or Business Administration
* Payroll skills and use of common accounting software are required, previous experience in QuickBooks or related programs preferred
* Effective time management skills and ability to prioritize crucial and potentially dynamic deadlines
* Strong knowledge of standard accounting practices and procedures
* Accuracy and attention to detail is absolutely required, as well as a track record of reliability, confidentiality, and conscientious work habits
* Exceptional proficiency with Microsoft Excel
* Ability to work independently with little supervision
* Ability to adapt and work efficiently in a rapidly changing environment with fluctuating client schedules

* Strong interpersonal communication skills
* Attention to detail with exceptional level of accuracy
* Ability to interpret data and make cost\-effective decisions
* Proactive, resourceful, and self\-motivated problem solver

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
We are expanding our team and searching for a Fractional (Part\-time) Chief Financial Officers in the **Greater Boston area.**

**Who are we?**

The CFO Centre Group is the global no. 1 provider of portfolio CFO services and, to support growing demand, we are looking to add to our team of CFOs to deliver the company’s unique style of portfolio CFO services: delivering time, money and peace of mind to entrepreneurial owner managers of small to mid size businesses ($2M \- $100M).

SMBs typically do not need, or want, a full\-time CFO but do need ongoing financial leadership. Our model provides them with a flexible, affordable option to acquire this skill set from a business whose purpose is making a real difference to our worldwide client base.

**What’s the opportunity?**

We’re expanding our team in Boston and are looking for highly experienced, client\-focused CFOs with entrepreneurial drive to work closely with the business owners/CEOs of SMBs in and around Boston.

If you’re an experienced Chief Financial Officer and you're looking for variety and flexibility in your working life, the chance to build a business, as well as to be part of a local, national and global team, then read on, this might be for you.

The role is self\-employed, whilst operating within a defined model, combining the benefits of being part of a team and supported by a well\-established organisation, but with a level of autonomy and freedom in how you deliver outcomes for clients.

**What do we do?**

We define and deliver the numbers that *really* matter. What does that mean? Well, anyone can come up with numbers, the difference with us is that we help our clients find the numbers that *really* make a difference, not only to their business, but to their lives, and help deliver them! Whether that’s growth, acquisition, consolidation, exit or setting them up for the lifestyle they’ve always wanted.

*“Working with The CFO Centre has been a game changer for me and my business. Not only have we doubled our revenue but I’m now able to focus on the things that really matter in the business now”. – CEO, Client Company*

**Could this be for you?**

You’ll join a collective team of CFOs who, between them, bring together thousands of years of collective experience to supercharge our clients’ businesses. We are 750\+ people, in 5 continents, across 17 countries – a truly global team.

*“I started here 4 years ago and I’m loving the lifestyle and loving the difference I can make to the clients I’m working with.”*

**Do you have experience in any of the following?**

· Driving strategic direction of a business

· Increasing profit

· Sourcing funding

· Improving cash flow

· Selling/exiting businesses

· Tightening up compliance, Improving systems and controls

· Optimizing tax and legal

. Implementing KPI reporting

· Mergers and acquisitions

· Identifying risks, Reviewing business plans

**The ideal candidate will be:**

· A strong ‘people person’ with a natural ability to build relationships;

· A ‘team player’ who thrives on contributing to a high performance team;

· Highly networked and love meeting new people, developing business and ensuring client satisfaction;

· Energetic, motivated, able to make things happen; with a desire to build businesses;

· Organized and dependable;

· Entrepreneurial and non\-corporate, seeking the freedom to work semi\-autonomously;

title: Director, Operations
description:
**Company info**
================



NewLimit is a biotechnology company working to radically extend human healthspan. We're developing medicines to treat age\-related diseases by reprogramming the epigenome, a new therapeutic mechanism to restore regenerative potential in aged and diseased cells. We leverage functional genomics, pooled perturbation screening, and machine learning models to unravel the biology of epigenetic aging and disease using experiments of unprecedented scale.


**Description**
===============



NewLimit is seeking a Director of Operations to support our scientific teams and build a strong G\&A function. This is a high\-impact role focused on increasing our effectiveness, efficiency, and execution velocity. Your goal will be to make NewLimit more effective on the margin, rather than to handle a narrowly circumscribed set of tasks. Your initial remit will include serving as the internal point of contact for Finance, Legal, and Business Development activities and managing our internal Operations team (LabOps, Facilities). Your role will increase in scope alongside the company. You will work closely with NewLimit's Executive Team and report directly to the Cofounder \& President.


**What you'll do**
==================



As a Director of Operations at NewLimit, you will:


* Own our Finance and Legal functions with support from fractional executives. Prepare and deliver budgets, projections, and regular financial statements.
* Support the development of medicines by sourcing vendors, negotiating contracts, and overseeing external CRO/CDMO partners.
* Manage facilities and laboratory operations to drive efficiency. Analyze workflows, inventory systems, and allocate capital expenses. Help us get more done per dollar invested.
* Create business development relationships with both buy side and sell side partners.
* Get your hands dirty. Everyone Executes at NewLimit. This is a role for someone excited to jump into any problem that arises in building the company.

**Requirements**
================


* Operating experience in a biotech, technology, or manufacturing company (e.g. Technical Operations, Product Management, Process/Industrial Engineering, Finance, Business Development, management consulting).
* Degree in a technical field (natural sciences, computer science, engineering) strongly preferred.
* Financial modeling skills. You should be familiar with a balance sheet and a P\&L, but you don't need to be a CPA.
* Experience optimizing a scientific or technical system to improve quality or output. We're excited to hear a story about a time you turned an inefficient system into an excellent one.

**Nice to have**
================


* Experience managing a team and allocating a departmental budget
* History of contributions to therapeutics development (Tech/Clin Ops, etc)
* Technical domain knowledge in the life sciences or computer science. Scientific output (publications, technical reports, software repositories) or a Ph.D. are a plus.
* History of establishing successful business development relationships

**Benefits**
============



NewLimit offers generous benefits to ensure our team can focus on our mission:


* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* 401(k) with company match
* Paid parental leave
* Industry\-leading paid time off (PTO) — 20 days/year for all employees \+ holidays
* Meals and snacks on\-site


Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including a candidate's qualifications, skills, competencies, and experience. NewLimit offers a competitive benefits package, which includes a 401k, healthcare coverage, and 20 days of PTO. Learn more at: https://www.newlimit.com/careers \*This compensation and benefits information is based on Company's good faith estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future.

description:
**Innosphere \- Marketing \& Communications Director**

**Location:** Colorado/Wyoming Front Range; Headquarters in Fort Collins (In\-Person 2\-3 days per week)

**Reports to:** CEO Primary/COO Secondary / Member of Executive Leadership  
**Employment Type:** Full\-time or Fractional/Part\-time (or contractual), depending on candidate experience and organizational fit

**Compensation:** $140,000 – 150,000/year (full time equivalent). Total compensation is flexible and may be adjusted based on experience, scope of responsibilities, and benefits elections (e.g., candidates who opt out of benefits). Fractional compensation will be negotiated based on time allocation.

**Benefits:** Innosphere offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision coverage; employer\-matched retirement; generous paid time off; including medical, dental, and vision coverage, retirement with employer contribution, generous paid time off, and holidays.

**About Innosphere**

Innosphere is a nonprofit innovation platform dedicated to accelerating technology startups and strengthening the regional innovation economy. For more than 25 years, Innosphere has supported entrepreneurs through startup acceleration, venture capital, real estate–based innovation campuses, and nationally significant initiatives, including the National Science Foundation (NSF)\-funded ASCEND Engine.

Innosphere operates at the intersection of entrepreneurship, research commercialization, capital formation, and economic impact—working with founders, corporations, universities, philanthropies, and government partners to build a more dynamic and resilient innovation ecosystem.

**Position Overview**

Innosphere seeks a senior, strategic Marketing \& Communications Director (Full Time or Fractional) to elevate our brand, sharpen our strategic narrative, and directly support revenue growth through philanthropy, corporate sponsorships, and high\-impact events.

The ideal candidate is an experienced marketing executive who thrives in entrepreneurial, mission\-driven environments and can translate complex innovation initiatives into compelling narratives that attract funders, partners, and ecosystem stakeholders.

This individual will focus on:

· Strategic marketing direction

· Brand architecture and positioning

· Fundraising communications

· Executive visibility

· High\-impact event strategy

· Oversight of marketing contractors and internal team members

Executional work (design, email production, social posting, etc.) will be supported by staff and/or contractors.

**Job Responsibilities:**

**Establish a Clear, Unified Strategic Brand Position**

* Develop and implement a cohesive brand architecture across:
* Innosphere (nonprofit)
* Innosphere Ventures (venture capital funds)
* NSF ASCEND Engine (CO \& WY)
* Corporate and philanthropic initiatives
* Refresh core messaging, positioning, and value propositions.
* Create a clear narrative framework for:
* “Bold Moves to Lift Colorado’s Advanced Industries”
* Corporate partnership strategy
* Philanthropic campaigns
* Deliver a CEO/COO\-approved brand strategy and narrative framework.

**Directly Support Revenue Growth Through Strategic Communications**

* Develop fundraising messaging frameworks for:
* Major gifts (HNW and DAFs)
* Corporate sponsorships
* Bank/CRA partnerships
* Build marketing support for annual fundraising goals (in coordination with the CEO and Partnerships Director).
* Support the development of materials that contribute to:
* Multi\-year philanthropic commitments
* Corporate partnership revenue growth
* Implement executive\-level storytelling that enhances credibility with:
* Family offices
* Corporate executives
* Regional and national funders

**Elevate Executive \& Organizational Visibility**

* Develop and execute a CEO visibility strategy:
* Thought leadership positioning
* Speaking strategy
* Strategic LinkedIn and media presence
* Increase high\-value audience engagement (investors, founders, corporate leaders).
* Identify and secure at least 3–5 high\-impact speaking or visibility opportunities annually.

**Design and Lead High\-Impact Events Strategy**

* Develop a strategic events portfolio aligned with fundraising and brand goals.
* Elevate flagship events into revenue\-generating, relationship\-building platforms.
* Increase:
* Sponsor revenue
* Executive attendance
* Funders and strategic partner engagement
* Establish event ROI metrics (revenue, qualified leads, sponsorship conversion).

**Build Scalable Marketing Infrastructure**

* Oversee marketing budget, contractors, agencies, and internal staff.
* Implement KPI dashboards aligned with strategic goals (brand awareness, engagement, fundraising support).
* Ensure consistent cross\-platform brand execution.
* Develop annual marketing plan aligned with organizational OKRs.

**Ideal Candidate Profile**

We are seeking a candidate who is:

* 10\+ years of progressive experience in marketing, communications, or brand leadership, with demonstrated experience leading teams, managing budgets, and partnering with senior leadership and external partners.
* Motivated by building organizations of consequence and measurable regional impact.
* Highly self\-directed, proactive, and accountable.
* Experience leading marketing strategy while managing execution through teams and/or external agencies, with clear accountability for outcomes.
* A strong people leader with experience managing and developing teams.
* A strategic thinker who can also execute effectively.
* An excellent communicator and storyteller across formats and audiences.
* Collaborative, team\-oriented, and comfortable working across functions.
* Experienced in marketing, communications, or brand leadership in innovation, economic development, nonprofit, or entrepreneurial environments.
* Experience supporting fundraising or ecosystem\-building initiatives is a strong plus.

**What Success Looks Like**

In the first year, success in this role means:

* Innosphere has a clear, implemented, and consistently expressed brand.
* Marketing materially strengthens philanthropic and corporate funding efforts.
* Visibility and credibility increase across target innovation ecosystems.
* Events are recognized as high\-impact, must\-attend convenings.
* The marketing and communications team is aligned, effective, and well\-managed.
* Budgets and vendors are managed with accountability and purpose.
* Marketing is viewed internally as a strategic growth enabler.

**Why Join Innosphere**

This is a rare opportunity to lead marketing and communications for a nationally significant innovation platform at a pivotal moment of growth. You will have the autonomy to shape strategy, the influence to partner closely with executive leadership, and the platform to elevate work that truly matters.

At Innosphere, marketing is not a support function; it is a strategic driver of visibility, momentum, and impact. This role offers the chance to help shape the future of entrepreneurship and innovation across the region and beyond.

title: Operations & Finance Manager
description:

We are seeking a high\-level **Operations \& Finance Manager** to bring clarity, discipline, and scalable infrastructure to our internal business operations.

This role reports directly to the Founder.

**WHO WE ARE**

We’re a small, hospitality\-focused marketing agency serving restaurants, lifestyle brands, and experience\-driven businesses across the Southeast. We are a lean, high\-performing team of four with strong profitability, thoughtful client partnerships, and ambitious growth goals.

We’re doers. We make things happen, and always from a place of service to our clients and to each other. We move fast, but we have fun and we’d rather eat dirt than take ourselves too seriously. Our work though \- it's serious business. We do what it takes so the work can speak for itself.

*Our Values*

* *Lead with empathy.*
* *Words matter.*
* *Deliver value.*
* *Take the extra step to surprise \+ delight.*
* *Do more with less \- always be resourceful but never cut corners and always deliver excellence.*

**WHO YOU ARE**

You are:

* Financially fluent and comfortable building and interpreting P\&Ls
* Experienced in service\-based or agency business models
* Highly organized and systems\-oriented
* Proactive and confident in recommending improvements
* Calm, detail\-driven, and clear in communication (verbal and written)
* Comfortable working independently in a small, fast\-moving team

Our company is profitable, lean, and growing. This role exists to protect (and increase) margins, increase financial clarity, build scalable systems, return leadership time, and strengthen infrastructure for growth.

**We are not looking for task support. We are looking for ownership.**

**WHAT YOU’LL OWN**

**Financial Leadership \& Reporting**

* Own invoicing across all clients
* Manage and follow up on accounts receivable
* Prepare and deliver clean monthly P\&L statements by the 10th of each month
* Monitor agency profitability by client and service line
* Identify expense inefficiencies and recommend improvements
* Support budgeting and cash flow visibility

You will help ensure the agency maintains strong, sustainable margins while scaling.

* Audit and streamline internal workflows

* Ensure contracts and scopes align with profitability targets
* Build repeatable systems for onboarding clients and team members

* Identify operational bottlenecks and propose solutions

* Protect strategic focus time

* Ensure operational follow\-through across initiatives

This role exists to increase leadership capacity while strengthening financial discipline.

* 5\+ years in operations, finance, or business management
* Experience in a small agency, startup, or entrepreneurial business
* Strong QuickBooks proficiency
* Experience with payroll systems (Gusto preferred)

Bonus:

* Experience working with hospitality, restaurant, or lifestyle brands

description:
Snowflake is about empowering enterprises to achieve their full potential — and people too. With a culture that’s all in on impact, innovation, and collaboration, Snowflake is the sweet spot for building big, moving fast, and taking technology — and careers — to the next level.

Snowflake has a unique opportunity, with the technology, people and processes, to help our customers to become truly data\-driven, enabled by the Data Cloud. The adoption of the Data Cloud will be industry\-specific and Snowflake tailors our approach to different industry needs.

Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

Two of San Francisco's most recognized icons, Ghirardelli Square and Fairmont Hotels \& Resorts, have partnered to create the city's most distinctive and exciting luxury residential accommodations, Fairmont Heritage Place, Ghirardelli Square.

* Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within your property and across the world!
* Ability to make a difference through our Corporate Social Responsibility activities

  

Job Description **Position scope**

  

Under the business supervision of the Director Residences, and within the limits of ACCOR policies and procedures, HOA (Homeowner’s Association) governing documents, and local requirements, the position is responsible for the oversight of the properties Revenue/Rental Program and supervision/responsibility of the property’ participation in the Global Accor Ownership Benefits Program as well as the Rental Programs.

  

The Revenue Manager will provide strategic leadership and management of all revenue/rental programs for the property with understanding of HOA governance on Owner Relation Programs, the Accor Ownership Benefits Programs, and Rental Programs. The candidate will be a highly motivated team player with strong skillsets in finance, revenue management, communication, business presentation, analysis, and fluent knowledge of HOA governing documents and City Rental Ordinances.

 **Core Duties and Responsibilities**

 ***Revenue Management / Rental Program***

* Creation and embracing the culture of business partnering by working with the General and Executive Committee, ACCOR Central Reservations (GRC), and ACCOR Residential Owner Services team . The Revenue Manager is responsible for achieving optimal revenue generation and returns for ACCOR and our owners while adhering to applicable governance and required compliance.
* Partner and collaborate with key members of the GRC / VIP Customer Care Team \- Americas, to provide strategic leadership and functional guidance for HGS property rates, programs, and related Owner Revenue Fee streams.
* Provide accurate and complete revenue management reports on a timely basis to property management, Accor Residential and HOA in accordance with the company (ACCOR) and ownership (HOA) reporting requirements and policy
* Review financial performance of rental and minor operating department, analysis of variances, forecasts, and budgets and create strategies to continually improve effectiveness of the business or revenue management within the boundaries of governing company (ACCOR) and ownership (HOA) documents
* Manage all Owner Rental Programs of the HOA in compliance with governing documents and management agreements in collaboration with Owner Services Department.
* Manage the inventory in collaboration with Owner Services on Reciprocal Use Programs of the HOA in compliance with governing documents and management agreements while collaborating with Accor Residential Owner Services
* Attend monthly Credit Meetings and functional responsibility of credit policy, collections, and deposits.
* Update databases (RMS,PMS, market share) as needed
* Develop and execute pricing strategies and rate parameters for all revenue streams
* Prepare and lead Weekly Rev/Max meetings
* Actively monitor and engage with IDeaS G3 RMS
* Analyze competitive set pricing and yield strategies
* Partner with Front Office on Upsell initiatives.
* Manage all OTA, Airbnb, and IATA Commissionable programs for the property.
* Monitor booking pace for all market segments and deploying strategies to maximize revenues.
* Manage and oversee all LSOP’s related to Rental Program, Long Stay / Extended Stay Guest Contracts.
* Oversee Rental Reservation Inbox responding to individual and group booking inquiries
* Manage all relevant rate codes for property and ensure rates are in parity
* Creation of annual Special Events Calendar to ensure restrictions and rates are set during peak demand periods.
* Manage all Owner Revenue Streams for the property and create accurate reporting to the company (ACCOR), Accor Residential, and Owners participating in ACCOR Rental Program.
* Collaborate with sales \& marketing community to maximize unit and/or fractional sales and owner values
* Adhere to GDPR, PCI Compliance, and all local/state regulations.
* In addition to the preparation of all revenue/ rental program performance and statistical reports, and any other special report that may be required by corporate office or the General Manager, the Revenue Manager is responsible for interpreting said reports and then communicating the results with the Executive Team and relevant department heads.

Qualifications **Qualifications**

* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Business, or a relevant field of work, or an equivalent combination of education and work\-related experience
* Good knowledge of Opera, IDeaS Revenue Management Software and GD’s an asset.
* Strong Knowledge of Opera and Microsoft Excel required.
* Minimum of two years of Revenue Management related experience
* Previous Front Office Management experience an asset.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects under time constraints.
* Demonstrated experience in leading \& developing people. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written to address all levels within the organization and ownership community and ability to gain consensus and influence others.
* Fluent in Microsoft Window applications and relevant computer applications
* Highly responsible \& reliable with exceptional attention to detail
* Ability to work cohesively as part of a team
* Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times

Must be legally eligible to work in the United States of America. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining U.S. work authorization.

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.


By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

description:
**About Catalyst OGC**

Catalyst OGC is a fractional general counsel and M\&A advisory firm serving middle‑market businesses preparing for sale, acquisition, or growth. We work alongside founders, private investors, and executive teams to execute complex transactions and build legally sound, transaction‑ready companies.

Our work spans mergers and acquisitions, corporate structuring, governance, contracts, and transaction execution across multiple industries and jurisdictions. We operate in a fast‑moving, entrepreneurial environment where attorneys are expected to think commercially, move decisively, and deliver practical solutions.

**Position Summary**

Catalyst OGC is seeking an M\&A Attorney to lead and execute middle‑market transactions from LOI through closing. This is a hands‑on role for a lawyer who can manage deal mechanics, coordinate stakeholders, and keep transactions moving.

The ideal candidate has strong transactional training, excellent judgment, and the ability to operate with a high degree of autonomy in a fast‑paced advisory environment.

**Location**: Utah preferred; remote considered for the right candidate

**Job Type**: Full‑Time

**Compensation**: $100\-$200/hour

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead and manage middle‑market M\&A transactions (buy‑side and sell‑side) from LOI through closing.
* Draft, review, and negotiate transaction documents, including LOIs, asset and stock purchase agreements, disclosure schedules, and ancillary agreements.
* Develop and manage diligence strategy, issue‑spot risks, and propose practical, business‑oriented solutions.
* Coordinate deal timelines, workstreams, and closing processes with clients, counterparties, and advisors.
* Assist with post‑closing matters, including transition and clean‑up items.
* Advise clients on entity structuring, governance, and transaction readiness.
* Draft and revise operating agreements, shareholder documents, consents, and related governance materials.
* Support reorganizations, roll‑ups, and intercompany structuring.
* Review and negotiate commercial agreements that affect valuation, risk, or diligence outcomes.
* Identify key contract risks such as assignment restrictions, change‑of‑control provisions, exclusivity, IP ownership, and termination rights.
* Assist clients in improving contracting practices and legal infrastructure.
* Serve as a trusted advisor to founders and executive teams.
* Translate legal risk into clear business guidance.
* Contribute to internal playbooks, templates, and process improvements to scale deal execution.

**Qualifications**

* J.D. and active bar license in at least one U.S. jurisdiction (Utah preferred but not required).
* 7\+ years of experience in mergers and acquisitions and general corporate law.
* Demonstrated ability to manage deals or major workstreams with limited supervision.
* Strong drafting and negotiation skills across purchase agreements, governance documents, and commercial contracts.
* Excellent organization and project management skills.
* Clear, confident communicator with a practical, solutions‑first mindset.
* Experience with private equity, roll‑ups, or platform acquisitions is a plus.

**What This Role Is (and Is Not)**

This role is best suited for attorneys who:

* Enjoy direct client interaction.
* Are comfortable taking ownership of matters.

description:
Under the direction of the Chief Executive Officer (CEO), the Interventional Cardiologist is responsible for providing comprehensive diagnostic and interventional cardiovascular care in both inpatient and outpatient settings. This role includes performing cardiac catheterizations, percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI), advanced intracoronary imaging and physiology assessments, pacemaker implantation, hemodynamic support management, and related procedures. The physician ensures high\-quality, evidence\-based patient care while collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to support the organization’s mission, clinical excellence, and patient safety standards.

**Position Summary**



Under the general supervision of the Chief Executive Officer, the Interventional Cardiologist provides comprehensive diagnostic and interventional cardiovascular care. Responsibilities include performing invasive cardiac procedures, managing complex coronary and structural heart disease, and delivering high\-quality patient\-centered care in both inpatient and outpatient settings.

  


**Required Qualifications**


* Doctor of Medicine (MD) or Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO) degree from an accredited institution.


* Completion of an accredited General Cardiology Fellowship.


* Completion of a specialized Interventional Cardiology Fellowship (typically 1–2 years).


* Minimum of three (3\) years of interventional cardiology experience.


* Board eligible or board certified in Interventional Cardiology (e.g., American Board of Internal Medicine).


* Current and valid Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS) certification.


* Active and unrestricted state medical license.


* Ability to handle confidential information with discretion, professionalism, and within regulatory standards.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Demonstrated experience in high\-volume catheterization laboratory settings.


* Experience managing complex coronary lesions and high\-risk PCI cases.


* Proficiency with advanced hemodynamic support devices.


* Experience with structural heart procedures and advanced imaging modalities.


**Principle Clinical/Technical Duties**


* ***Category: Diagnostic \& Interventional Procedures***



o Perform left and right heart catheterizations, including Swan\-Ganz catheterization for hemodynamic pressure measurements (RA, RV, PA, wedge).



o Performs percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), including angioplasty and coronary stent placement.



o Manage complex coronary lesions and high\-risk interventional cases.



o Utilize fluoroscopy and coronary angiography for diagnostic and therapeutic procedures.



o Perform transesophageal echocardiograms (TEE) and electrical cardioversions.

  


* ***Category: Advanced Imaging and Hemodynamic Support***



o Demonstrate proficiency in intravascular ultrasound (IVUS), optical coherence tomography (OCT), and fractional flow reserve (FFR).



o Utilize Shockwave intravascular lithotripsy technology.



o Manage intra\-aortic ballon pumps (IABP) and Impella ventricular assist devices.



o Insert temporary and permanent pacemakers.



o Perform insertion of implantable loop recorders.


* ***Category: Vascular Access \& Patient Management***



o Perform radial artery (wrist) and femoral artery (groin) vascular access and management.



o Provide peri\-procedural and post\-procedural patient care and monitoring.



o Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams including nursing staff, anesthesiology, and critical care.



o Ensure compliance with hospital policies, quality standards, and safety protocols.


* ***Category: Other Duties***



o Other duties as assigned

The work environment includes a healthcare setting including a hospital, out\-patient services, and clinics. Exposure to infectious diseases, hazardous materials, and varying patient conditions may be possible. Some positions may be subject to working outdoors for prolonged periods.
